result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse E. Stegall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: by the Order of the Court
letter from VIP Program Director, Mike Champion, dated 07/14/16 in re:  defendant has completed all conditions of sentence to VIP Program; requesting a successful discharge

Defendant Jesse E. Stegall in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:34 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  VIP recommendation. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  
Counts 2 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD entry of the Judgment of Conviction.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Participate in VIP program for 6 months and upon successful completion count 2 will be dismissed and count 3 pay a fine of $50 plus costs.  
pursuant to the conditions referenced in the VIP program assessment and recommendations. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse E. Stegall
Current: 1424 East Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2015)
Prior: 6287 Old Highway 18, Stevens Point, WI 54482

Defendant Jesse E. Stegall in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/ng entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with E.K.W. dob 2/11/99 or his residence.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Criminal Damage to Property, Physical Abuse of a Child.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1500 signature  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 6/29/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
